title.rendered: PSG suspended Lionel Messi for 2 weeks without pay for an unauthorized UAE trip

content.rendered:
As per the latest report, Paris Saint- Germain club has suspended Lionel Messi for two weeks. It is without pay following an unauthorized trip to Saudi Arabia. Messi flew off to Saudi Arabia soon after playing in PSG’s 3- 1 home League 1 defeat to Lorient on Sunday. He went there with his family. It was as part of his commitment to a minister for Saudi Arabia. He posted an image on Instagram with the comment “Who knows Saudi Arabia is so much green?”

“I love to explore its unanticipated cautions whenever I can #visitsaudi.”

(Read Also: Sheikh Jassim and Jim Ratcliffe are the final bidders to buy Manchester United)

As per the latest report by L’Equipe and ESPN that the trip wasn’t authorized. PSG director Christophe Galtier told players they could have Monday and Tuesday off if they beat Lorient. But a loss would require them to join for training. Messi had permission to travel to Saudi Arabia If PSG beat Lorient. Messi played the entire 90 minutes of the 3- 1 loss, which is PSG’s third defeat in their last four league games. He also flew to Saudi Arabia and was not present at training on Monday.

As per the report, some players were disappointed with the incident. PSG suffer a 3-1 home defeat to Lorient Klopp charged by FA over adjudicator commentary According to L’Equipe, Messi has now been suspended by PSG for two weeks. During that time, he’ll not be suitable to take part in training, won’t be paid, and won’t play for the club. Messi is set to miss the coming two PSG games, at Troyes this Sunday, and against Ajaccio on May 13. He can return against Auxerre on May 21. PSG will also only have three games left as they look to mantle up the Ligue 1 title. They’re presently five points clear of alternate-placed Marseille. Messi’s future at PSG looks uncertain. A return to Barcelona is under discussion. There has also a way that he could move to MLS.
